intro: Desmodiastrum, commonly known as the yellow burr plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, spiny pods that contain seeds. The plant is native to various regions of the Americas, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. Desmodiastrum species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor soil conditions. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in some regions.
